intro: Minuartia rimarum var. multiflora, commonly known as the rock pink, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit, with fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in crevices or on rock faces. Its botanical features make it well-suited for rocky gardens and xeriscaping.
